p: The treatment of breast cancer generally begins with surgery, followed by a combination of a variety of adjuvant therapies, including hormone therapy, chemotherapy, and radiotherapy. [ 6â€“ 8] Nevertheless, these advanced treatments are inherently aggressive and increases the exposure of patients to the side-effects of treatment. Female patients with breast cancer, particularly the patients who have undergone radical mastectomy, are facing huge pressure in their life. This includes damaged body images due to the loss of breasts, which can result in enduring and experiencing the negative effects of subsequent unhealthy emotions.
